name: CreateNewIssue
description:
Create a new issue in the system.

This tool is used to create a new issue in the system. It should be called whenever there's a need to log or track a new issue or task.

parameters.name: issue_details
parameters.description: A JSON object containing issue details including account_id, assignee_id, attachment_urls, body_html, contact_id, and other optional fields. This data structures the issue to be created, indicating ownership, assignment, and any additional contextual information like attachments or destination preferences.

account_id.description: The account that this issue belongs to.

assignee_id.description: The user the issue should be assigned to.

attachment_urls.description: An array of attachment URLs to attach to this issue.

body_html.description: The HTML content of the body of the issue.

contact_id.description: Optional contact ID to post the message as. Only one of user_id or contact_id can be provided.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the issue was created. If not specified, the current time will be used. (RFC3339)

slug.description: The slug of the custom field.

value.description: The value of the custom field. Only to be used for single-valued custom fields. If unset, the custom field will be unset. If the custom field is a select field, the value must be the select option slug, which you can find from the GET /custom-fields endpoint.

values.description: The values of the custom field. Only to be used for multi-valued custom fields (ex. multiselect). If unset, the custom field will be unset. If the custom field is a multiselect field, the values must be the select option slugs which you can find from the GET /custom-fields endpoint.

custom_fields.description: An array of custom fields to be used on this issue.

chat_widget_app_id.description: The ID of the chat widget app to use for in-app chat.

destination.description:
The destination type of the issue. Can be "email", "slack", "in_app_chat", or "internal". Defaults to "internal".

* slack APIIssueDestinationSlack  Deliver to the issue's account's Slack channel.

* email APIIssueDestinationEmail  Deliver messages to the issue requester via email.

* in_app_chat APIIssueDestinationChatWidget  Deliver messages to the issue requester via in-app chat.

* internal APIIssueDestinationInternal  Keep the issue internal and don't contact the requester at all.

email.description: The email that emails to the requester will be sent from. You must configure an email app in Pylon with this address.

email_bccs.description: Emails that will be BCCed on emails to the requester.

email_ccs.description: Emails that will be CCed on emails to the requester.

destination_metadata.description:
You can configure the issue to contact the requester via email, Slack, in-app chat, or not at all.

If a destination other than `internal` is specified, a message with the issue's BodyHTML will be delivered to the requester. If you don't wish to immediately contact the requester, you can specify the `internal` destination.

priority.description: The priority of the issue. Can be one of: urgent, high, medium, or low.

requester_avatar_url.description: The URL of an avatar of the requester.

requester_email.description: The email of the user that this issue is on behalf of. Include one of requester_id or requester_email to create an issue with a requester.

requester_id.description: The requester that this issue is on behalf of. Include one of requester_id or requester_email to create an issue with a requester.

requester_name.description: The full name of the user that this issue is on behalf of.

tags.description: An array of strings to use as tags on this issue. If provided, the issue tags will be updated to the given tags.

team_id.description: The ID of the team this issue should be assigned to.

user_id.description: Optional user ID to post the message as. Only one of user_id or contact_id can be provided.
